title: Budget differences between Congress and president

content.description:
PROPOSED CUTS BY PRESIDENT VERSUS THE BUDGET PASSED BY CONGRESS

Percent Change in 2018 Funding from Enacting 2017 Funding, By Department or Agency

Source: Congressional Budget Office; Office of Management and Budget, 2018
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the data in the bar chart?

choices.label: The president has greater influence on foreign policy than does Congress.
Congressâ€™ proposal would lower taxes, which is more popular with taxpayers.
The executive branch usually asks for more funding than it needs since Congress is likely to reduce the amount when they approve the budget.
The president is not supportive of the EPA, but members of Congress have checked the president's power by not approving a cut in funding for the agency.

content.answer: The president is not supportive of the EPA, but members of Congress have checked the president's power by not approving a cut in funding for the agency.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
